title: Why I Chose Information Science and Technology
summary: Exploring my journey into the world of Information Science and what excites me most about the future of technology.
content: When I first started learning about Information Science, I was fascinated by how data, systems, and people all come together. This post is about the key experiences that shaped my interest...

title: Top 5 Tools Every Tech Student Should Know
summary: A list of essential tools I use daily as a tech student—from Git to VS Code.
content: As a third-year student, I’ve learned that productivity often comes down to the tools you use. In this post, I break down my top 5 favorite tools and how I use them in school and personal projects.

title: Building My First Portfolio Website
summary: Lessons I learned from designing and coding my own portfolio site with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
content: This was both a fun and challenging project! I had to figure out everything from layout and design to JavaScript interactivity. I share how I planned the site, some mistakes I made, and what I'd do differently next time.

title: How I Stay Focused During Finals
summary: Balancing project deadlines and exam prep is tough—here’s my personal focus system that works.
content: Finals season always feels chaotic. Over time, I developed a routine that keeps me productive without burning out. I use time blocking, the Pomodoro technique, and music playlists to stay in the zone.
